headline: Chef John's Turkey Sloppy Joes
description: This turkey Sloppy Joe recipe is Chef John's lighter version of the home-style beef Sloppy Joe that's lighter yet still packed with flavor!

video.description: See how to make Sloppy Joes with ground turkey!
video.name: Turkey Sloppy Joes

name: Chef John's Turkey Sloppy Joes
recipeIngredient: salt and ground black pepper to taste
0.5 teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir onion in butter until lightly brown, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and black pepper.

Mix turkey and 1/2 cup cold water into onions. Cook and stir, breaking up the meat, until it begins to brown, about 2 minutes. Add ketchup, brown sugar, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper. Cook and stir until liquid is reduced, about 5 minutes.
Stir in Worcestershire sauce and cocoa powder. Cook, stirring frequently, until meat is cooked through and liquid is reduced and thick, 20 to 30 minutes, adding up to 1 cup water if needed.
Preheat the oven's broiler. Set the oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source.
Toast hamburger buns under the preheated broiler until golden, 2 to 3 minutes.
Remove turkey mixture from the heat; mix in cheese and green onions. Serve on toasted hamburger buns.

review.reviewBody: It was a little too sweet but t will make again with less sugar!!!!ðŸ˜ƒ

Have been making this recipe for YEARS, and when the weather gets cooler my serious carnivore husband looks forward to my making it! The only thing I occasionally switch up is to sub molasses for the brown sugar. I feel that it makes for more depth of flavor, but I get that molasses may not be a pantry staple for everyone,
This was an excellent sloppy Joe!!!

This was fabulous! Because of having only one pound, I cut ketchup to 1/4 C each ketchup and BBCue sauce. Lowered brown sugar to 1/2 T. Upped Worcestershire to 1 tsp. Added a splash of each: mustard, vinegar, garlic. Cooking longer with water did make the turkey softer, and the cheese and onion made it!
This recipe is top shelf with ground turkey it is much easier on the stomach loved it!

Iâ€™ve made this many times and it is delicious. However, the last time I made it I didnâ€™t have enough ketchup. I used equal parts ketchup and Sweet Baby Rayâ€™s BBQ Sauce and we enjoyed the flavor even more

This has been in our regular rotation for a couple of years now, and the whole family enjoys it. I do have a couple of issues with the recipe, though. First, it calls for 1 1/4 lbs of ground turkey, which is challenging since it's usually sold in 1-lb packages. So I usually have to do some mental math to make the ratios come out right. My other issue is that final step of cooking it in water for another 20-30 minutes, because the meat gets fully cooked WAY before that point. I usually go for a much shorter cooking time.

Loved this recipe!! The unsweetened cocoa powder was genius and adds a great dimension of flavor! The only thing I did differently was added some diced green bell pepper and slightly reduced the amount of brown sugar by 1/2 a tablespoon.

Loved this! We followed the recipe exactly (except cheese and green onions), then placed in a slow cooker on warm setting to serve to picnic guests. Just before guests were ready to eat I layered on the cheese and green onions. They served themselves! Delicious with sweet hot pickles and your favorite chips.
Great recipe!
This was easy & tasted great. Highly recommend. I'll make it again soon.
I made the recipe exactly as stated. It tasted nothing like a sloppy joe. very disappointed
The family loved this recipe.
Most importantly, itâ€™s EASY. It tastes good and can be made keto friendly if using no sugars added ketchup and swerve brown sugar.

This is a good recipe but I found that it was very sweet. I added almost an entire 6oz can of tomato paste to get a true tomato base along with a teaspoon of apple cider vinegar. Additionally, I only added about a half cup of water at the end. If you are sensitive to spicy you might consider adding only 1/4 tspn cayenne.
I have never been a fan of sloppy joes until I made this. Love this recipe!
Loved it, very tasty, followed recipe, except used a little less Cayenne for hubby. And didn't add any additional water, other than the initial 1/2 Cup.

My husband and have made this two times. Itâ€™s absolutely delicious, both savory and sweet and spicy. We used less water, 1 pound of turkey because you canâ€™t buy 1.25 pounds, 1 teaspoon of Worcestershire. Adding the green onions and shredded cheddar at the end thickens it, and is genius.
I loved these every bit as much as Chef Johnâ€™s hamburger sloppy joes. The mix was delicious and held together fabulously on the toasted bun. Yummy!

Absolutely brilliant. One note, I did not do the step of putting 1/2 cup of water in with the turkey. I didnâ€™t understand why you would use this technique? In any case, this was delicious. I would not change a thing. As other reviewers remark, it is enough sloppy joe to satisfy that craving but different enough to be interesting and fresh. A wonderful recipe I am sure we will make again and again.
Great Recipe, Hub loved it on my homemade butternut squash Kaiser rolls.
Awesome! Easy and good for the whole family. Made it as is. Thanks Chef John!

My family absolutely loved these. I had never had a sloppy joe growing up so I had no idea what they are supposed to taste like and was totally scared of messing it up. The recipe is super easy. I made a few small tweaks (I added a little more cocoa powder and Worcestershire) but basically stuck to the recipe and it was a hit. We will be making them again.
Great recipe! My family loves it, I make it at least twice a month.

This was really delicious! I went mostly by the recipe and only omitted the cooked onion and used onion flakes instead as my husband doesn't care for cooked onions. I also opted to add a little less than the half cup of water it called for as I wanted to be sure the consistency was a little thicker. It came out great and my non-sloppy-joe-eating husband ate a large one and complimented how good it tasted! I will absolutely make these again and again!
Did not care for it. Like others have mentioned, it lacked zip. Needs mustard and or vinegar. Will not be making again.
My husband says these are the best Sloppy Joes he has ever had! The only change I made was using cold chicken broth instead of cold water.
Excellent version of sloppy joes. We tried with a combo ground turkey and lean beef, it was a winner.

Who knew sloppy joes could be elevated?! Delicious, especially with Hawaiian burger buns. Opted out of the green onions (didn't have) and I let everyone do their own serving of cheese. Will definitely go into regular rotation
I made this for dinner one night. Instant hit! Everyone loved it, even my beef or pork only husband!

This may be the best sloppy joe I have ever had. Great recipe. It wouldn't be an All Recipes review if i didn't change something....I browned the meat slightly before adding the water. My thought was that this would cook meat faster and more evenly and allow the sauce to be a little more "saucy"
I made it with a little less ketchup and added bbq sauce in its place. Yum!

No time? No problem! This is absolutely delicious, even if you have to cook it at warp speed. I was in a hurry, so I omitted the water and cooked the turkey and onions together until done. Added the rest of the ingredients and simmered together for approx. 10 mins. It was DELICIOUS. Family went nuts for it. I served it over warm cornbread. I'll be making this again for sure. No doubt the longer simmer time would really add depth of flavor, but it was so easy this way I might just use this method again next time.

Wow, I just finished making and eating this and had to review! This was delicious. I used frozen onion, because that is what I had on hand, squirted a couple squirts of yellow mustard to the mix and also cooked meat in 1/2 cup marsala cooking wine and 1/2 cup water. I did not need to add the additional one cup of water at the end. Do not skip the cayenne pepper or the cocoa. Thank you for the recipe. Will definitely add to my dinner rotation.

This is absolutely delicious. Made it for dinner last night and my husband and I both loved it. We had it for lunch today and it was even better. I didnâ€™t add the green onions at the end because I didnâ€™t have any. Great recipe!!
Chef John does it again! Finger lickin' good. The whole family loved it!
This was a very flavorful Sloppy Joe. The touch of cocoa powder is perfection, and the consistency is moist but not runny. Will make again.
Good base recipe. I did everything as written but also added some red pepper flakes, dry mustard, and a bit of paprika for more flavor.
Awesome recipe! Made it several times with no substitutions. Lots of flavor and savory. One time I did use half Sriracha ketchup because I didnâ€™t have enough regular. Was super yummy that way too!
Will definitely make again.
I have never made Sloppy Joes but being "self quarantined " I am trying new and different recipes and this was a pleasant surprise. It was tasty and I will make this again.

I made this after reading reviews so I reduced the amount of water and let the turkey brown a little before adding all the sauce ingredients and water. I also added fresh sweet corn. I used garlic butter at the very beginning and on the buns too. Would make again. Forgot to photograph so the picture is halfway through eating.

This tastes similar but so much better than the store bought one . 
Donâ€™t leave out the chocolate. I did add two tsp of white vinegar - needed a little acid . 
This is better the next day . We all really enjoyed this meal . Will def make it again .

My husband picked up the ingredients and even though he purchased a brand of ground turkey I dont particularly care for it still turned out great! I made two pounds of meat since I wanted to have plenty of leftovers. With the additional meat I added an "extra" half of each ingredient, except for the ketchup. We only used one cup instead of 1.5.
Thanks again Chef John!
this was soooo delicious. My son has food allergies so it's nice to find a great recipe that can work for him. Thank you!

My wife and I made this dish and we were not disappointed. The only modification we made to the recipe was skipping the cayenne pepper. It was sweet and tangy. I think next time I will add some sweet peppers.
A tad sweet from ketchup. I will add more Worcester sauce next time. But still delicious, comfy food. Thxs.
I'm going to stop looking for sloppy Joe recipes, this one is perfect just the way it is.
Easy and delicious with 93% beef. I use coconut aminos instead of Worcestershire and omit green onions.
Amazing! Flavorful and tasty. I substituted sugar products for none and added peppers and onions. I will be making this again soon.

If you like ketchup, and I mean REALLY like ketchup, then this recipe is for you. As you may know, ketchup has a lot of sugar in it. I made the recipe exactly as written and it was overpoweringly sweet. I managed to save it by adding a bunch of tomato paste and tomato sauce to my liking. I would recommend replacing at least half of the ketchup that's called for in this recipe to be replaced with tomato paste and/or tomato sauce.
I added green bell peppers and did everything else as the recipe said and it was excellent! Definitely will be making again!
I was hesitant to give it a try but once I tasted it, I couldn't stop eating!
Turkey Sloppy Joes were delicious!
Very delicious!!! So glad I found this recipe. My husband loves it. Very easy to make and will definitely make it often. Thank you Chef John!!
Very delicious!!! So glad I found this recipe. My husband loves it. Very easy to make and will definitely make it often. Thank you Chef John!!
Delicious
Nope, no changes. It was great!
I didn't add the cocoa powder and used only a pound of turkey my first time making this. Now making it again for a second time because it's addictive!
I made this as written. My husband loved it and asked that it be put into the regular rotation! I would not change a thing. I served it with a light cole slaw. Thank you Chef John!

This sloppy joe recipe is yummy and everyone that I have served it to, enjoyed it too, and requested the recipe. The only changes I made were: I chopped and sauted some of the little (red, orange, yellow) sweet peppers with the onions, and I added some garlic to the mixture also. I cut the suggested cayenne pepper amount in half, and I did not add additional black pepper. The toasted buns, and green onions and cheese were delicious suggestions and added to the scrumptiousness of the sandwich. A friend of mine requested (yellow) mustard for her sandwich, so that was put on the table as an additional option. Everyone like this tangy offering also, and followed suit. It added another dimension of flavor. Thanks Chef John!
I followed the recipe I just did my own measurements? lol
I thought this was ok. husband didn't like it at all. only change I made was to use coconut sugar instead of brown sugar. they taste similar by that was all I had on hand. thanks for sharing though.

worked great with what I had in the fridge. added quinoa flakes to thicken a bit. unfortunately the whole family (I have 4 sons) decided they couldn't stand to eat it. (they are not a fan of sloppy joes). my husband and I ate it, but probably will not make again.
LOVED IT! Made it on whole wheat buns....we couldn't get enough of it! Absolutely recommend it for a weeknight meal.

Thank-you Chef John for sharing this! I loved it because we don't eat red meat and we don't like bell peppers, and it tastes great! The only thing I did differently was to only put half the called for cayenne pepper in. It's very easy to make. My husband says it's a "definite repeat".
Personal note - skip onions for the kids. Instead, caramelize and crisp some onion in oven to put on top.
I've made this several times. I love spicy food, so added a little more cayenne pepper than the recipe. Once on the bun, I like to top with canned, fried onions to add some crunch. Delicious!
I didn't have any cocoa powder so I substituted hot chocolate powder. You would never know it. I added carrots and celery. It is delicious.

We liked this recioe. Next time I will add a fraction of the brown sugar and increase the Worstershjre sauce. Also, 1/2 t. Of cayenne would overpower this for me, I added about 1/8 t. And that was just enough heat for me.
Super good.
Wonderful just as written!
Delicious! Didn't change a thing. Will never serve it out of a can again!
I add instant coffee instead of cocoa. Since it's turkey I call it Sloppy Tom's.
Fabulous! Great weeknight dinner! Fast, easy, common pantry ingredients and great flavor!
I have made these for big groups, add a little more cheese. They are awesome! Make sure you do as instructed to cook this down with the water. Soo good.
I doubled the recipe and it was good. A little too sweet for me so I think I will reduce the sugar next time. Otherwise, very good!
Hi, I have made these a couple of times and my husband and I love them. I added fresh garlic to the onions while I sauteed them, but that was the only addition!

We make this often. It's easy and scrumptious, and has a unique tangy flavor. I usually add a little tomato paste to give it more of a tomato flavor, and I also double the Worcestershire just because I like it. (Don't add extra cocoa though -- I tried that and it tasted too chocolatey.) I find you don't have to simmer it for as long as the recipe says.
NO changes - perfect the way it is.
Yummy! I reduced the amount of spices slightly and water as I only had 1 lb of ground turkey. Thanks Chef John. Will make again for sure.

Best sloppies ever!
A few changes:
olive oil vs butter
dehydrated onion vs fresh
tomato paste vs ketchup
no sugar
Definitely making again!

I had only 1lb. ground turkey so I made minor adjustments. I agree with other reviewers--don't add so much water in the beginning. You can add later if needed. Why so skimpy on the Worcestershire? I added a little more. Turnec out kind of sweet but I liked it. A less sweet ketchup may help tamper the Sweet. Next time I'll use better and leaner ground turkey, too. Good recipe!
Delish just as it is written. thanks again Chef John!
I added a bit of garlic powder and 1/2 a chopped red pepper. Loved it! Will definitely make again!

They were delicious! I did half regular ketchup and half jalapeno ketchup for a little added spice; everyone LOVED them! I knew it was a home run when my stepson, who is a very picky eater asked for more!

How did anyone think this did not have any flavor????? This was good and HOT. Spicy HOT! Whoa! I think the cayenne to taste is exactly that! I put too much and gotta cut back next time! This is definitely one I will do again, just with less cayenne! Delicious!
Excellent! My husband and I both loved these. Even better as leftovers for lunch. Another great recipe from Chef John who never disappoints.
Very good but a little too sweet. Go slow and add to taste at the end. Probably depends on the brand of ketchup! I used ground beef instead and drained the fat.
Perfect! Didnâ€™t need to change a thing!
Little less cayenne and little less brown sugar. Overall fantastic.
Made it as written and wouldn't change anything. I loved the thick rich sauce. I did not add any additional water to the recipe besides the 1/2 cup to start. Very good!
Very good flavor. Easy to make. Sometimes turkey can be bland but this has the perfect amount of heat. I will definitely keep this in the routine rotation.

Amazing! I came across this after my husband randomly asked for Sloppy Joeâ€™s and I didnâ€™t want the canned stuff. I added 2tsp white vinegar, like I read in the reviews, and 3 cloves of garlic. Itâ€™s perfect, not too spicy but with a kick. I was nervous about the cocoa, but it definitely added to the flavor. New weeknight staple!
Made as written except added red pepper that needed to be used. Very good!

I had my doubts using turkey, but this recipe is spot on. Heck, even my kids loved it and I easily packed away two hefty sandwiches. I left out the green onions for the kids portion and sprinkled them on mine. I would suggest using close to the full 1 cups of water to get the sauce very thick. 

It doesn't matter if you use brand name ketchup and you can definitely add some zing by adding mustard or a touch or BBQ sauce to the mix as well, but this is perfect as is.

I will definitely make this again. I was searching for a day before grocery shopping lunch idea and came across this. I had to make a couple of changes due to lack of ingredients. I had to omit the green onions but will make sure I have them on hand for next time. I substituted gouda for the cheddar. I didn't have cocoa powder but did have unsweetened bakers chocolate so I used that. I also just used plain white bread. Only thing I would change on purpose is I will fully brown the turkey before adding other ingredients. I prefer a firmer bite. Don't be afraid to try it!
I liked this but I think I just don't like the taste of turkey with these flavors.

Made according to recipe other than that I browned the chicken rather than "boiled" it in water. Added only about 1/2 c of water as I added the ketchup. And only 1 tbsp of brown sugar.
Used my home-made ketchup
